post.title: Rendering WordPress Blocks in a headless environment
post.content:
This example demonstrates rendering WordPress Blocks with JSX in a Next.js project. The example includes 16 block components across various categories. Example includes a utility to convert flat blocks data from GraphQL response into the hierarchical data structure. Passing this data into BlockRenderer component generates the WordPress content by matching the appropriate blocks and using a default block when block implementation is missing. Default block is also customizable component. Example also gives an option to provide custom HTML parser to render HTML content.

Text blocks

  • Unordered list item
  • Unordered list item
    • Unordered list item deep
      • Unordered list item deeper
  1. Ordered list item
  2. Ordered list item
    • Ordered list item deep
      • Ordered list item deeper

Heading – H1

Heading – H2

Heading – H3

Heading – H4

Heading – H5
Heading – H6
<CodeBlock />
Preformatted block <pre>

Quote block

Quote citation

Media blocks

Design Blocks

Button with link
Button without link

Column 1

This is a first column of the two column layout

Column 2

This is a second column of the two column layout

This is the separator below
